maml:description.maml:para: Sets your API key used to authenticate all API calls
The Add-FanartTVAPIKey cmdlet sets your API key which is used to authenticate all API calls made to FanartTV

Note: When both keys are provided, the personal key determines the access tier (2-day delay instead of 7-day). When both query parameter and header are present for the same key type, the query parameter takes priority
Plain text personal key
If not defined the cmdlet will prompt you to enter it
Plain text project key
Plain text personal key
If not defined the cmdlet will prompt you to enter it
Plain text project key

dev:remarks.maml:para: Prompts to enter in the personal API key which will be stored as a SecureString
Adds both project & personal keys which will be stored as a SecureString

maml:description.maml:para: Sets the base URI for the FanartTV API connection
The Add-FanartTVBaseURI cmdlet sets the base URI which is used to construct the full URI for all API calls
Sets the base URI for the FanartTV API connection. Helpful if using a custom API gateway
The default value is 'https://webservice.fanart.tv'
Sets API to use
Note: Module was built and tested on v3.2 only
The default value is 'v3.2'
Sets the base URI for the FanartTV API connection. Helpful if using a custom API gateway
The default value is 'https://webservice.fanart.tv'
Sets API to use
Note: Module was built and tested on v3.2 only
The default value is 'v3.2'

dev:remarks.maml:para: The base URI will use https://webservice.fanart.tv/v3.2
The base URI will use https://gateway.celerium.org/v3.2
The base URI will use https://gateway.celerium.org/v3.2

maml:description.maml:para: Converts uri filter parameters
The ConvertTo-FanartTVQueryString cmdlet converts & formats uri query parameters from a function which are later used to make the full resource uri for an API call
This is an internal helper function the ties in directly with the ConvertTo-FanartTVQueryString & any public functions that define parameters
Hashtable of values to combine a functions parameters with the ResourceUri parameter
This allows for the full uri query to occur
Hashtable of values to combine a functions parameters with the ResourceUri parameter
This allows for the full uri query to occur

dev:remarks.maml:para: Example HashTable: $UriParameters = @{ 'filter[id]'] = 123456789 'filter[organization_id]'] = 12345 }

maml:description.maml:para: Exports the FanartTV BaseURI, API, & JSON configuration information to file
The Export-FanartTVModuleSettings cmdlet exports the FanartTV BaseURI, API, & JSON configuration information to file

Making use of PowerShell's System.Security.SecureString type, exporting module settings encrypts your API key in a format that can only be unencrypted with the your Windows account as this encryption is tied to your user principal This means that you cannot copy your configuration file to another computer or user account and expect it to work
Define the location to store the FanartTV configuration file
By default the configuration file is stored in the following location: $env:USERPROFILE\Celerium.FanartTV
Define the name of the FanartTV configuration file
By default the configuration file is named: config.psd1
Define the location to store the FanartTV configuration file
By default the configuration file is stored in the following location: $env:USERPROFILE\Celerium.FanartTV
Define the name of the FanartTV configuration file
By default the configuration file is named: config.psd1

dev:remarks.maml:para: Validates that the BaseURI, API, and JSON depth are set then exports their values to the current user's FanartTV configuration file located at: $env:USERPROFILE\Celerium.FanartTV\config.psd1
Validates that the BaseURI, API, and JSON depth are set then exports their values to the current user's FanartTV configuration file located at: C:\Celerium.FanartTV\MyConfig.psd1

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the FanartTV API key
The Get-FanartTVAPIKey cmdlet gets the FanartTV API key from the global variable and returns it as a SecureString
Decrypt and return the API key in plain text
Decrypt and return the API key in plain text

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets the Api key and returns it as a SecureString
Gets and decrypts the API key from the global variable and returns the API key as plain text

maml:description.maml:para: Shows the FanartTV base URI
The Get-FanartTVBaseURI cmdlet shows the FanartTV base URI from the global variable

dev:remarks.maml:para: Shows the FanartTV base URI value defined in the global variable

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the saved FanartTV configuration settings
The Get-FanartTVModuleSettings cmdlet gets the saved FanartTV configuration settings from the local system
By default the configuration file is stored in the following location: $env:USERPROFILE\Celerium.FanartTV
Define the location to store the FanartTV configuration file
By default the configuration file is stored in the following location: $env:USERPROFILE\Celerium.FanartTV
Define the name of the FanartTV configuration file
By default the configuration file is named: config.psd1
Opens the FanartTV configuration file
Define the location to store the FanartTV configuration file
By default the configuration file is stored in the following location: $env:USERPROFILE\Celerium.FanartTV
Define the name of the FanartTV configuration file
By default the configuration file is named: config.psd1
Opens the FanartTV configuration file

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets the contents of the configuration file that was created with the Export-FanartTVModuleSettings
The default location of the FanartTV configuration file is: $env:USERPROFILE\Celerium.FanartTV\config.psd1
Opens the configuration file from the defined location in the default editor
The location of the FanartTV configuration file in this example is: C:\Celerium.FanartTV\MyConfig.psd1

maml:description.maml:para: Imports the FanartTV BaseURI, API, & JSON configuration information to the current session
The Import-FanartTVModuleSettings cmdlet imports the FanartTV BaseURI, API, & JSON configuration information stored in the FanartTV configuration file to the users current session
By default the configuration file is stored in the following location: $env:USERPROFILE\Celerium.FanartTV
Define the location to store the FanartTV configuration file
By default the configuration file is stored in the following location: $env:USERPROFILE\Celerium.FanartTV
Define the name of the FanartTV configuration file
By default the configuration file is named: config.psd1
Define the location to store the FanartTV configuration file
By default the configuration file is stored in the following location: $env:USERPROFILE\Celerium.FanartTV
Define the name of the FanartTV configuration file
By default the configuration file is named: config.psd1

dev:remarks.maml:para: Validates that the configuration file created with the Export-FanartTVModuleSettings cmdlet exists then imports the stored data into the current users session
The default location of the FanartTV configuration file is: $env:USERPROFILE\Celerium.FanartTV\config.psd1
Validates that the configuration file created with the Export-FanartTVModuleSettings cmdlet exists then imports the stored data into the current users session
The location of the FanartTV configuration file in this example is: C:\Celerium.FanartTV\MyConfig.psd1

maml:description.maml:para: Makes an API request to FanartTV
The Invoke-FanartTVRequest cmdlet invokes an API request to the FanartTV API
This is an internal function that is used by all public functions
Defines the type of API method to use
Allowed values: 'GET'
Defines the resource uri (url) to use when creating the API call
Hashtable of values to combine a functions parameters with the ResourceUri parameter
This allows for the full uri query to occur
The full resource path is made with the following data $FanartTVModuleBaseURI + $ResourceURI + ConvertTo-FanartTVQueryString
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Defines the type of API method to use
Allowed values: 'GET'
Defines the resource uri (url) to use when creating the API call
Hashtable of values to combine a functions parameters with the ResourceUri parameter
This allows for the full uri query to occur
The full resource path is made with the following data $FanartTVModuleBaseURI + $ResourceURI + ConvertTo-FanartTVQueryString
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Invoke a rest method against the defined resource using the provided parameters
Example HashTable: $UriParameters = @{ 'filter[id]'] = 123456789 'filter[organization_id]'] = 12345 }

maml:description.maml:para: Removes the FanartTV API key
The Remove-FanartTVAPIKey cmdlet removes the FanartTV API key(s) from global variables0
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Removes the FanartTV API key global variables

maml:description.maml:para: Removes the FanartTV base URI global variable
The Remove-FanartTVBaseURI cmdlet removes the FanartTV base URI from the global variable
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Removes the FanartTV base URI value from the global variable

maml:description.maml:para: Removes the stored FanartTV configuration folder
The Remove-FanartTVModuleSettings cmdlet removes the FanartTV folder and its files This cmdlet also has the option to remove sensitive FanartTV variables as well
By default configuration files are stored in the following location and will be removed: $env:USERPROFILE\Celerium.FanartTV
Define the location of the FanartTV configuration folder
By default the configuration folder is located at: $env:USERPROFILE\Celerium.FanartTV
Define if sensitive FanartTV variables should be removed as well
By default the variables are not removed
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Define the location of the FanartTV configuration folder
By default the configuration folder is located at: $env:USERPROFILE\Celerium.FanartTV
Define if sensitive FanartTV variables should be removed as well
By default the variables are not removed
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Checks to see if the default configuration folder exists and removes it if it does
The default location of the FanartTV configuration folder is: $env:USERPROFILE\Celerium.FanartTV
Checks to see if the defined configuration folder exists and removes it if it does If sensitive FanartTV variables exist then they are removed as well
The location of the FanartTV configuration folder in this example is: C:\Celerium.FanartTV

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieve the latest fanart images for a specific resource
The Get-FanartTVLatest cmdlet retrieve the latest fanart images for a specific resource.
Resources are Movies,TV Shows, & Music
What type of latest resource to retrieve
Allowed values: 'Movies','TV Shows','Music'
Date to return items updated after
By default, returns movies updated in the last 2 days
Date is converted to Unix timestamp
What type of latest resource to retrieve
Allowed values: 'Movies','TV Shows','Music'
Date to return items updated after
By default, returns movies updated in the last 2 days
Date is converted to Unix timestamp

dev:remarks.maml:para: Retrieve all available fanart images for movies updated in the past 2 days
Retrieve all available fanart images for movies updated since the defined date

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieve all available fanart images for a specific movie
The Get-FanartTVMovie cmdlet retrieve all available fanart images for a specific movie
Movie identifier (TMDB ID or IMDB ID with 'tt' prefix)
Examples: 550 - TMDB ID (Fight Club) tt0137523 - IMDB ID (Fight Club)
Movie identifier (TMDB ID or IMDB ID with 'tt' prefix)
Examples: 550 - TMDB ID (Fight Club) tt0137523 - IMDB ID (Fight Club)

dev:remarks.maml:para: Retrieve all available fanart images for a specific movie

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieve all available music artist and album images
The Get-FanartTVMusic cmdlet retrieve all available music artist and album images
What type of image to retrieve
Allowed values: 'Artist','Album','Label'
MusicBrainz Artist ID (MBID) MusicBrainz Release Group ID MusicBrainz Label ID

Examples: Artist - 20244d07-534f-4eff-b4d4-930878889970 - MusicBrainz ID (Taylor Swift) Album - 70816f08-b7d1-4e77-817e-8c1426751de0 - MusicBrainz Release Group ID (Taylor Swift) Label - be994c3e-0527-404f-b8f9-455e217e83d2 - MusicBrainz Label ID (Profile Records)
What type of image to retrieve
Allowed values: 'Artist','Album','Label'
MusicBrainz Artist ID (MBID) MusicBrainz Release Group ID MusicBrainz Label ID

Examples: Artist - 20244d07-534f-4eff-b4d4-930878889970 - MusicBrainz ID (Taylor Swift) Album - 70816f08-b7d1-4e77-817e-8c1426751de0 - MusicBrainz Release Group ID (Taylor Swift) Label - be994c3e-0527-404f-b8f9-455e217e83d2 - MusicBrainz Label ID (Profile Records)

dev:remarks.maml:para: Retrieve all available fanart artist images for a specific music artist
Retrieve all available fanart album images for a specific music album
Retrieve all available fanart label images for a specific music label

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieve all available fanart images for a specific TV Show
The Get-FanartTVShow cmdlet retrieve all available fanart images for a specific TV Show
TV Show identifier (TVDB ID)
Examples: 76703 - TVDB ID (Pokemon)
TV Show identifier (TVDB ID)
Examples: 76703 - TVDB ID (Pokemon)

dev:remarks.maml:para: Retrieve all available fanart images for a specific TV Show
